intro: Schmidtia cherlerioides, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Schmidtia cherlerioides is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in its native habitat.
